meanings.sent1: After the rain stopped, she decided to resoak the laundry for extra cleanliness.
meanings.sent2: I accidentally spilled water on the tablecloth, so I had to resoak it before the stain set in.
meanings.sent3: He resoaked his sponge in the soapy water, but it slipped from his hand and landed on his foot!
meanings.sent4: The dry sponge eagerly resoaked the water, as if it had been waiting for this moment.
meanings.sent5: The fabric was so dirty that she had to resoak it multiple times to get it clean.

meanings.sent1: The towel fell into the puddle and quickly resoaked, making it heavy to carry.
meanings.sent2: The dry soil resoaked with rainwater, turning into mud that stuck to our shoes.
meanings.sent3: The sponge resoaked itself in the sink, surprising everyone with its thirst for water.
meanings.sent4: The cloth resoaked in the spilled juice, absorbing every drop like a thirsty plant.
meanings.sent5: The towel resoaked in the ocean waves, becoming a soggy mess in no time.
